result.execSummary:
The defendant Steve Anthony Hardin Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steve Anthony Hardin Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steve Anthony Hardin Jr was found guilty of Intentionally Contact Victim/Witness/Co-Actor after Court Order for Misdemeanor Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.
  • Steve Anthony Hardin Jr was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Court ordered the defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges including DV surcharge and assessments while on probation in COUNT 2. Any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

Huber privileges for work and child care. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Concurrent with: with CT 2 and with revocation.

charges.descr: Intentionally Contact Victim/Witness/Co-Actor after Court Order for Misdemeanor Conviction

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Straight time. No good time credit.
Consecutive to: any sentence

miscConds.notes: Successfully complete an anger management/Batterers Intervention program. Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication.
AODA assessment and comply with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.
No contact with the victim without the approval of the court or Department of Corrections. 3rd party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by agent.
Obtain/maintain employment. Obtain GED or HSED. Attend parenting class.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Court costs, surcharges including DV surcharge to be paid; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Restitution set at ZERO. Pay all supervision fees.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession; Voting.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges for work and child care.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steve Anthony Hardin Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter on behalf of the Defendant, received and filed.

Attorney Reyna I Morales in court, defendant Steve Anthony Hardin not in court, in custody.  Chris Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for status. Br 12 is in trial.  Defense request a plea/sentencing hearing.  State will attempt to contact the victim for sentencing.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-24-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna I Morales in court via telephone, defendant Steve Anthony Hardin not in court, in custody.  Chris Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defense counsel had a medical appointment and could not appear today. Defense is request a short adjournment.    Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Further proceedings scheduled for 02-13-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steve Anthony Hardin in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Steve Anthony Hardin in custody.  Chris Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KMD and/or her family or residence or the address 3521 N 20th Street, Milwaukee, WI

Defendant Steve Anthony Hardin in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Steve Anthony Hardin in custody.  Kurt Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Court entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 1 preserving Defendant's right of substitution.  DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
